pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, July 31, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, July 31, 2017:

Williams Lake, British Columbia

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of National Defence, Harjit Sajjan, the Minister of Sports and Persons with Disabilities and Chair of the Ad Hoc Cabinet Committee on Federal Recovery Efforts for 2017 BC Wildfires, Carla Qualtrough, the Minister of Justice, Jody Wilson-Raybould, and the Premier of British Columbia, John Horgan, will meet with Canadian Armed Forces and RCMP members from the Williams Lake Wildfire Command Centre.

Cariboo Memorial Recreation Complex
Parking Lot
525 Proctor Street                  

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity
  • Media should arrive no later than 10:00 a.m.

12:10 p.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of National Defence, the Minister of Sports and Persons with Disabilities and Chair of the Ad Hoc Cabinet Committee on Federal Recovery Efforts for 2017 BC Wildfires, the Minister of Justice and the Premier of British Columbia will visit the Cariboo Fire Centre.

Cariboo Fire Centre
3020 Airport Road

Notes for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity
  • Media should arrive no later than 11:45 a.m.

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister, the Minister of National Defence, the Minister of Sports and Persons with Disabilities and Chair of the Ad Hoc Cabinet Committee on Federal Recovery Efforts for 2017 BC Wildfires, the Minister of Justice and the Premier of British Columbia will participate in an aerial tour of the fire zones in the region.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity only

2:20 p.m. The Prime Minister and the Premier of British Columbia will hold a media availability.

Cariboo Fire Centre
3020 Airport Road

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 2:00 p.m.
